title: X Factor's Simon Cowell praises Nick Grimshaw - but admits Louis could be back as a guest judge - The X Factor Reality TV -
text: Simon Cowell has praised Nick Grimshaw on The X Factor, calling him "passionate" and "fun".Speaking on tomorrow's Good Morning Britain, the music mogul said it was particularly difficult for Grimmy as he was replacing Louis Walsh, who had been on the show for more than a decade. © ITV / Thames The X Factor 2015: You can help the judges decide who to take to the live shows"I like [Grimshaw and Rita Ora]. I mean, they settled in really quickly," he told Susanna Reid."The truth is that when you replace someone like Louis, it takes a while for people to get used to the person they've really, really liked for ten years. So regardless of who was going to come in and take his role, there was always, 'Well, you're not Louis', and you've got to give people a little bit of time."But now I've got to know [Grimshaw] as a friend. He's passionate, he's fun, loves the job, very different from Louis, but I think he's doing a good job." © David M. Benett/Dave Benett / Getty Images for Coach) The X Factor 2015: See One Direction's Louis Tomlinson and Meghan Trainor at Judges' HousesCowell is also mulling over a potential return for Walsh."I've got the ghost of Louis everywhere at the moment," he said. "What's so weird is that when he was on the show, I'd always have people complaining about him."Now he's gone, it's like, 'Why isn't he there?'. So I don't know what's going to happen. © ITV / Nicky Johnston "I couldn't just bring him back. I do like the idea of maybe having a guest judge, something like that. That's a possibility."Watch the full interview on Good Morning Britain on Thursday (October 22) from 6am.The X Factor continues this weekend on ITV.
